title: Project Euler Problem 3: Largest prime factor
body:
Problem: The prime factors of 13195 are 5, 7, 13 and 29.
What is the largest prime factor of the number 600851475143 ?
Solution: Vá» cÆ¡ báº£n, Ä‘Ã¢y lÃ  bÃ i toÃ¡n phÃ¢n tÃ­ch má»™t sá»‘ thÃ nh thá»«a sá»‘ nguyÃªn tá»‘ vÃ  chá»n ra sá»‘ nguyÃªn tá»‘ lá»›n nháº¥t.
Äá»ƒ phÃ¢n tÃ­ch má»™t sá»‘ N thÃ nh thá»«a sá»‘ nguyÃªn tá»‘:
 Ta sáº½ liÃªn tá»¥c chia N cho sá»‘ nguyÃªn tá»‘ t(k) cho tá»›i khi khÃ´ng thá»ƒ tiáº¿p tá»¥c Ä‘Æ°á»£c ná»¯a. Tá»›i Ä‘Ã¢y: Náº¿u N > t(k) thÃ¬ ta tÃ¬m sá»‘ nguyÃªn tá»‘ t(k+1) quay láº¡i bÆ°á»›c trÃªn. Náº¿u N < t(k) thÃ¬ t(k) lÃ  sá»‘ nguyÃªn tá»‘ lá»›n nháº¥t. MÃ£ code vá»›i Rust.:  fn get_next_prime_number(arr: &Vec<i64>) -> i64 {let last_prime = arr.last().unwrap();let mut next_prime = last_prime + 1;loop {let mut is_valid = true;for x in arr {if next_prime % x == 0 {is_valid = false;break;}}if is_valid {break;} else {next_prime = next_prime + 1;}}return next_prime;}fn largest_prime_factor(mut n: i64) -> i64 {let mut arr = Vec::new();arr.push(2);let mut current_prime: i64;loop {current_prime = arr[arr.len() -1];while n % current_prime == 0 && n >= current_prime {n = n / current_prime;}if n > current_prime {let temp = get_next_prime_number(&arr);arr.push(temp);} else {break;}}return current_prime;}fn main() {println!("Larngest prime factor is: {}", largest_prime_factor(600851475143));}#[test]fn test_get_next_prime() {let mut arr = Vec::new();arr.push(2);let mut i = 0;while i < 10 {let temp = get_next_prime_number(&arr);arr.push(temp);i = i + 1;}assert_eq!(arr.len(), 11);assert_eq!(arr[1], 3);}#[test]fn test_largest_prime_factor() {assert_eq!(largest_prime_factor(13195), 29);}
